entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY/WINTER STORM WARNING BEGINS MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: February 15, 2026 1:50 p.m. A Winter Weather Advisory and a Winter Storm Warning will begin on Monday evening in central Douglas County. entry.title: Investigators allege Roseburg assistants caused student injuries
entry.summary: Two instructional assistants from the Roseburg School District are facing charges after an investigation into injuries sustained by students at Fremont Middle School, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 02.13.26
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith covers the highlights of what is happening during this session of the Oregon State Legislature.

entry.title: Canyonville School releases 2025-26 second quarter honor roll
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Canyonville School released the second quarter honor roll for the 2025-26 school year.

entry.title: Roseburg DMV closed Friday
entry.summary: The Roseburg Driver and Motor Vehicle (DMV) office is closed Friday due to staffing.

entry.title: LOCAL REAL ESTATE TODAY 02.13.26
entry.summary: Mary Gilbert, CEO of the Mary Gilbert Group powered by PLACE at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly local look at real estate:

entry.title: Police Log: February 12, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police made multiple arrests Feb. 12–13 including DUII cases, several warrant arrests, harassment, and prohibited camping enforcement. Incidents ranged from traffic stops and disturbances to a parole absconding arrest at the VA, according to the latest city police logs.

entry.title: Two Fremont Middle School Staff Arrested; District Confirms Active Investigation
entry.summary: Two Fremont Middle School staff members were arrested Thursday in connection with an investigation involving reported injuries to students in a specialized classroom program, according to Roseburg Schools. The district says it is cooperating with law enforcement as the investigation continues.

entry.title: Community Art Project to Transform Vacant Storefronts in Roseburg and Oakland
entry.summary: Vacant to Vibrant is hosting free community art workshops in Roseburg and Oakland to create “Portraits of Community,” a public installation filling vacant storefronts this summer. Residents are invited to attend March and April drop-in sessions to help make the art.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest will hire for seasonal positions
entry.summary: The Umpqua National Forest announced it will be hiring seasonal employees for the upcoming recreation season.

entry.title: Visit Roseburg Library for a Blind Date … with a Book
entry.summary: Readers are invited to take a chance on a book during Roseburg Public Library’s Blind Date with a Book giveaway.

entry.title: Roseburg artist Sharon Bedford opens new gallery Studio Arts Connection
entry.summary: Across her life, artist Sharon Bedford has developed a love for a wide variety of mediums including Painting, knitting, crochet, beadweaving, lapidary and metalsmithing, to name a few. Her newest venture allows her to not only display her work to…

entry.title: Ingram Content Group expands Roseburg distribution center with new printing facility
entry.summary: In 1994, physical and digital book distributor Ingram Content Group (ICG) opened its Roseburg distribution center, bringing jobs and industry to residents of Douglas County. This year, the company plans to push that even further.

entry.title: Father-Daughter Dance returns to Douglas County Fairgrounds for 2026 - Tickets Still Available
entry.summary: Umpqua Actors Community Theatre’s Father-Daughter Dance returns Feb. 20 at the Douglas County Fairgrounds in Roseburg. The evening includes music, dancing, photos and refreshments for dads and daughters. Tickets are $20 per person and available while space lasts.

entry.title: Sutherlin School District Selects Next Superintendent
entry.summary: Sutherlin School District has appointed Sutherlin High School Principal Jon Martz as superintendent starting July 1. The school board approved the hire after a search process. Martz will replace retiring superintendent Terry Prestianni and lead a district serving about 1,300 students.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest preparing to hire seasonal workers for summer
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest plans to hire seasonal workers for summer, with openings expected Feb. 20. Jobs in recreation, trails and resource management will be based in Glide, Roseburg, Tiller and Idleyld Park. Applicants must be 18 and apply through USAJOBS.

entry.summary: February 13, 2026 3:40 a.m. Earlier this week, the Sutherlin School District Board of Directors voted to appoint Jon Martz as the district’s next superintendent, effective July 1st, following a search led by McPherson & Jacobson LLC. A district release said Martz currently serves as principal of Sutherlin High School, a position he has held...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 02.12.26
entry.summary: Live from Washington D.C., Second District Congressman Cliff Bentz covers another of topics including the Bonneville Power Administration, the potential for a partial government shutdown and more.

entry.title: Low snowpack across Oregon could affect water levels and wildfire risk in Douglas County
entry.summary: Snowpack across Oregon is well below normal this winter, raising concerns about summer water supplies and wildfire risk. In southern Oregon, limited snowfall and early melting have already impacted snow recreation.

entry.title: Police Log: February 11, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police activity Feb. 11–12 included a probation detainer arrest after reports of a man yelling across several blocks, a trespass at a shelter, prohibited camping and drinking-in-public citations, and a suspended-driver stop on Garden Valley Blvd.

entry.title: Douglas County Commissioners pass motions on public works contracts, ballot remake stations
entry.summary: On Wednesday, the Douglas County Board of Commissioners held a meeting in which they passed motions regarding public works contracts, looked at an intergovernmental agreement regarding ballots and more.

entry.title: Public comment section open for Cedar Creek Project proposal, planning
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — The North Umpqua Ranger District in the Umpqua National Forest is working on conducting the Cedar Creek project, a vegetation management project in the middle and upper Steamboat Creek subwatersheds about 40 miles east of Glide.
